description:
Alterations and extensions to the College buildings (Class
D1) to provide new college facilities including lecture
theatre, library, refectory, teaching, research, offices and
ancillary activities comprising: -
(a) the demolition of the existing Harkness Hall, on the
Torrington Square side of the College, and the erection of a
extension in its place with basement, ground and seven upper
floors;
(b) the demolition of the existing top floor of the main
building and the erection of two additional floors;
(c) the erection of  plant room and open screened plant
enclosure above the two proposed additional floors on the
main building;
(d) the landscaping of Torrington Square to the east of the
College buildings;
as shown on drawing numbers and documents listed in schedule
dated 5th July 2001.

Condition : 2 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-8KHz
    inclusive, noise from all plant and machinery (measured in
    LAeq) shall at all times add not more than 1 decibel to the
    ambient noise level expressed as LA90 in the same octave
    band as measured 1 metre outside the window of any
    residential premises.

Condition : 4 - All new architectural features on the new upper floors above
    the original Holden building shall exactly match the
    detailed design and materials of the existing fourth floor
    and other floors of the Holden building in terms of
    materials and detailed design including brickwork, string
    courses, parapet/coping and fenestration (including
    proportions, glazing patterns, window reveals, glazing bar
    sections and window surrounds).

Condition : 5 - Prior to the implementation of the development, plans shall
    be submitted to and approved by the Council to show which of
    the existing pipes, plant and equipment at present on the
    external face of the building are to be retained. All plant,
    other than that agreed to be retained, shall be removed
    prior to the occupation of the floorspace hereby approved.
    No new pipes, plant or plumbing, other than rainwater pipes,
    shall be fixed on the external face of the building without
    consent first having been obtained.

Condition : 6 - All trees on the site, or trees growing on adjoining sites,
    unless shown on the permitted drawings as being removed,
    shall be retained and protected from damage to the
    satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least 12
    months following the completion of the development hereby
    approved, or such longer period as may be required under
    Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act
    1990.

Condition : 7 - The terrace outside the Class D1 ancillary refectory / cafe
    on the ground floor of Torrington Square extension hereby
    permitted shall not be used for such ancillary purposes
    outside the following times 07.30hrs to 22.00 hrs Mondays to
    Saturdays and 10.00 to 22.00hrs on Sundays.

Condition : 8 - No music shall be played in the refectory / cafï¿½ at any time
    in such a way as to be audible within any nearby premises,
    or on Torrington Square.

Condition : 9 - All hard and soft landscaping works to Torrington Square,
    later than the end of the following planting season, with
    others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives
    written consent to any variation.
    approved as part of the S106 agreement, shall be carried out
    to a reasonable standard in accordance with the landscape
    details to be approved in accordance with the timescales
    specified in the legal agreement. Any trees or areas of
    planting which, within a period of 5 years from the
    completion of the landscaping scheme, die, are removed or
    become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as

Condition : 19 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take

Condition : 20 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environment and Consumer
    Protection Service Pollution Team, Camden Town Hall, Argyle
    Street, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444), or to seek prior
    approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any difficulty
    in carrying out construction other than within normal
    working hours and by means that would minimise disturbance
    to adjoining premises.

Condition : 21 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council, which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 22 - The Council supports schemes for the recycling of bottles
    and cans and encourages all catering establishments to do so
    as well. Further information can be obtained by telephoning
    the Council's Street environment Service (Recycling) on 020
    7974 1553.

Condition : 23 - The details required pursuant to Additional Conditions 3 and
    5 which require to be discharged by the Council, should be
    submitted with the attached approval of details application
    form together with 6 sets of drawings and any other
    supporting information.

Condition : 24 - Noise measurement shall be carried out jointly by the
    acoustic consultant and the Council's Technical Officer for
    the area, on completion of the project, to ensure that the
    associated noise levels near residential premises are
    actually within the Council's requirements.

Condition : 25 - In good time, prior to the start of construction (or if
    appropriate, demolition) on site, the contractor shall
    discuss and agree with the Council's Streets Management
    Traffic Management Section (tel: 020-7974 5629) detailed
    arrangements for the transportation of goods and materials
    to and from the site. The Council will prosecute those
    responsible for any breaches of the provisions of the
    Highways and Litter Acts that occur as a result of
    construction on the site.

Condition : 26 - The enclosed leaflet sets out the Council's guidelines for
    the protection of trees on or adjacent to development sites.

Condition : 27 - You are advised that any external signage may require advert
    consent.
